# F# style guide

> Best practices and conventions for writing idiomatic F# code. Five principles: be succinct, expressive, and composable; be interoperable; use types to encode domain logic; use functions for behavior; favor composition over inheritance. Covers formatting, indentation, and naming conventions.

- [F# component design guidelines](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fsharp/style-guide/component-design-guidelines.md): Learn the guidelines for writing F# components intended for consumption by other callers.
- [F# coding conventions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fsharp/style-guide/conventions.md): Learn general guidelines and idioms when writing F# code.
- [F# code formatting guidelines](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fsharp/style-guide/formatting.md): Learn guidelines for formatting F# code.
- [F# style guide](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/fsharp/style-guide/index.md): Learn the five principles of good F# code.
